Submodules

CoREMOF.curate module

Process your CIF to “CoRE MOF” CIF.

class CoREMOF.curate.MOSAEC(folder, saveto='mosaec.csv')[source]

Bases: object

Check MOF by Metal Oxidation State Automated Error Checker [MOSAEC](https://github.com/uowoolab/MOSAEC).

Parameters:

  • folder (str) – path to your folder contain MOFs.

  • saveto (bool or str) – the name of csv file with clean result.

Returns:

  • result of MOSAEC.

Return type:

CSV

FILES_TO_DOWNLOAD = {'Ionization_Energies.csv': 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/uowoolab/MOSAEC/main/Ionization_Energies.csv', 'KnownON.csv': 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/uowoolab/MOSAEC/main/KnownON.csv', 'Oxidation_Probabilities.csv': 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/uowoolab/MOSAEC/main/Oxidation_Probabilities.csv', 'mosaec.py': 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/uowoolab/MOSAEC/main/mosaec.py'}
check_result(saveto)[source]
run_mosaec()[source]
class CoREMOF.curate.clean(structure, initial_skin=0.25, output_folder='result_curation', saveto='clean_result.csv')[source]

Bases: object

Removing free solvent and coordinated solvent but keep ions based on a list.

Parameters:

  • structure (str) – path to your CIF.

  • initial_skin (float) – skin distance is added to the sum of vdW radii of two atoms.

  • output_folder (str) – the path to save processed CIF.

  • saveto (bool or str) – the name of csv file with clean result.

Returns:

  • result of curating (name, skin, removed solvent).

  • CIF by curating.

Return type:

CSV or cif

class CoREMOF.curate.clean_pacman(structure, initial_skin=0.25, output_folder='result_curation', saveto='clean_result.csv')[source]

Bases: object

Removing free solvent and coordinated solvent but keep ions based on PACMAN-charge.

Parameters:

  • structure (str) – path to your CIF.

  • initial_skin (float) – skin distance is added to the sum of vdW radii of two atoms.

  • output_folder (str) – the path to save processed CIF.

  • saveto (bool or str) – the name of csv file with clean result.

Returns:

  • result of curating (name, skin, removed solvent, charge of solvent).

  • CIF by curating.

Return type:

CSV or cif

CoREMOF.get_mofid.remove_pbc_cuts(atoms)[source]

Remove building block cuts due to periodic boundary conditions. After the removal, the atoms object is centered at the center of the unit cell.

Parameters:

atoms (ase.Atoms) – aase.Atoms.

Returns:

  • The processed atoms object.

Return type:

ase.Atoms

CoREMOF.prediction.cp(structure, T=[300, 350, 400])[source]

predict heat capacity by GBR models at different temperatures: https://doi.org/10.1038/s41563-022-01374-3.

Parameters:

  • structure (str) – path to your structure.

  • T (list) – the temperatures of your system.

Returns:

  • unit by [“unit”], always “J/g/K”, “J/mol/K”.

  • predicted heat capacity of your structure.

Return type:

Dictionary

CoREMOF.prediction.download_file(url, save_path)[source]

download models from github due to limit of uploading size by PyPi.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – link of downloading file.

  • save_path (str) – the path to save files.

CoREMOF.prediction.f1(y_true, y_pred)[source]

Computes the F1-score for binary classification.

The F1-score is the harmonic mean of precision and recall, providing a balanced metric when the dataset is imbalanced. It is given by:

F1 = 2 * (precision * recall) / (precision + recall)

where:

  • Precision = TP / (TP + FP)

  • Recall = TP / (TP + FN)

Parameters:

  • y_true (tensor) – Ground truth binary labels (0 or 1).

  • y_pred (tensor) – Predicted probabilities or binary predictions.

Returns:

F1-score (between 0 and 1).

Return type:

tensor

CoREMOF.prediction.get_files_from_github(repo, path)[source]

query files from github due to limit of uploading size by PyPi.

Parameters:

  • repo (str) – github repository.

  • path (str) – the path of models.

Returns:

  • response of downloading.

Return type:

Dictionary

CoREMOF.prediction.pacman(structure, output_folder='result_pacman', charge_type='DDEC6', digits=10, atom_type=True, neutral=True, keep_connect=False)[source]

predict partial atom charge by PACMAN Charge: https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jctc.4c00434.

Parameters:

  • structure (str) – path to your structure.

  • output_folder (str) – the path to save CIF with predicted charges.

  • charge_type (str) – models of DDEC6, Bader, CM5 or REPEAT.

  • digits (int) – number of decimal places to print for partial atomic charges. ML models were trained on a 6-digit dataset.

  • atom_type (bool) – keep the same partial atomic charge for the same atom types (based on the similarity of partial atomic charges up to 2 decimal places).

  • neutral (bool) – keep the net charge is zero. We use “mean” method to neuralize the system where the excess charges are equally distributed across all atoms.

  • keep_connect (bool) – retain the atomic and connection information (such as _atom_site_adp_type, bond) for the structure.

Returns:

  • predicted PBE energy and bandgap of your structure.

  • CIF with predicted charges.

Return type:

Dictionary & cif

CoREMOF.prediction.precision(y_true, y_pred)[source]

Computes the precision metric for binary classification.

Precision is defined as the ratio of correctly predicted positive observations to the total predicted positive observations. It is given by:

precision = TP / (TP + FP)

where:

  • TP (True Positives) : Correctly predicted positive cases

  • FP (False Positives) : Incorrectly predicted positive cases

Parameters:

  • y_true (tensor) – Ground truth binary labels (0 or 1).

  • y_pred (tensor) – Predicted probabilities or binary predictions.

Returns:

Precision score (between 0 and 1).

Return type:

tensor

CoREMOF.prediction.recall(y_true, y_pred)[source]

Computes the recall metric for binary classification.

Recall (also known as Sensitivity or True Positive Rate) measures the proportion of actual positives that are correctly identified by the model. It is given by:

recall = TP / (TP + FN)

where:

  • TP (True Positives) : Correctly predicted positive cases

  • FN (False Negatives) : Actual positive cases that were predicted as negative

Parameters:

  • y_true (tensor) – Ground truth binary labels (0 or 1).

  • y_pred (tensor) – Predicted probabilities or binary predictions.

Returns:

Recall score (between 0 and 1).

Return type:

tensor

CoREMOF.prediction.stability(structure)[source]

predict stability of MOFs: https://doi.org/10.1021/jacs.1c07217, https://doi.org/10.1021/jacs.4c05879.

Parameters:

structure (str) – path to your structure.

Returns:

  • unit by [“unit”], always “nan, °C, nan”.

  • predicted thermal, solvent and water stabilities.

Return type:

Dictionary

  • output_folder (str) – path to save structures.

downloading CIF.

CoREMOF.structure.read_aif(GEMC_data)[source]

get adsorption amount of water from GEMC.

Parameters:

GEMC_data (list) – from detail_of_CR.json, for example, information(“CR-ASR”, “2020[Cu][sql]2[ASR]1”)[“GEMC”].

Returns:

  • information,by [“info”] always “(‘_units_loading’, ‘Molecules/Supercell’)”.

  • pressure by [“pressure”].

  • uptake by [“uptake”].

Return type:

Dictionary
